definition: (to take) a turn for the better/to change planes
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: If I have more than a seven-hour layover, I'd like to stay overnight.
sentences.chinese: 若是转机要等超过七小时，我希望在那里过夜再飞。

sentences.english: It depends, how long is stop over?
And this year was Chen Cheng's turn.
We are heading for Seatle and will change planes in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 我们即将前往西雅图，并在日本转机。

sentences.english: Given limited time for layover, we didn't venture out of the enormous Dubai airport.
sentences.chinese: 由于转机时间有限，我们没有离开诺大的迪拜机场。

sentences.english: Now there’s an opportunity to reverse that and put resources for development into villages.
sentences.chinese: 现在，出现了转机，可以向各村投入资源供其发展。

sentences.english: Long expensive also because investment promotion happens turnaround will be transferred to the town.
sentences.chinese: 长贵也由于招商的事情发生转机要被调到镇上。

sentences.english: Transit passengers should go to the interline counter.
sentences.chinese: 我是转机到旧金山的旅客。

sentences.english: And, what cause a people for a favourable turn and revolving stage with this is new think.
sentences.chinese: 并且，以此为转机和活动舞台引发出人们的新思考。

sentences.english: Their big break came when they discovered a trail of white register tape.
sentences.chinese: 案件的重大转机出现在他们发现了一溜白色收银发票。

sentences.english: How did they turn things around?
sentences.chinese: 它们是怎样出现转机的呢？

sentences.english: After several years' hard work, the business finally turned around.
sentences.chinese: 几年的惨淡经营后，生意终于出现了转机。

sentences.english: So I decided to visit India, first stopping in Malaysia then on to Mumbai.
sentences.chinese: 于是，我先停马来西亚，再转机到孟买。

sentences.english: I need to transfer the flight to RDU airport, North Carolina.
sentences.chinese: 我要转机去北卡，但是我的航班变了。

sentences.english: In Warren, Mich., Karen Alexander doesn't see a shift in the economy.
sentences.chinese: 密歇根州沃伦的卡伦亚历山大并不认为经济出现转机。

sentences.english: Some of this is alchemy, of course.
sentences.chinese: 当然，有些是带来转机的神奇力量。

definition: shift in the trend of events/turnaround/plot shift in a book/turn in the conversation
the road to happiness is strewn with setbacks (idiom)
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
the mountain road twists around each new peak (idiom)/(of a mountain road) twisting and turning/fig. an opportunity has come unexpectedly/things have taken a new turn
to come back from death's door (idiom); unexpected rescue from danger/fig. to recover from a seemingly impossible situation/to find a way out of a predicament
to set out on a journey
lit. the willow trees make the shade, the flowers give the light (idiom); at one's darkest hour, a glimmer of hope/light at the end of the tunnel
